ai-kv13.7:1.1_0: has attained the gratification of jhāna.
ai-kv13.7:1.3_0: Through the object of his absorption, his meditation subject enters.
ai-kv13.7:1.4_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv13.7:1.5_0: Through the object of his absorption, his meditation subject enters.
ai-kv13.7:1.7_0: By that contact there is feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness. Because of that contact, the feeling of perception, thoughts known by the mind.
ai-kv13.7:1.8_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv13.7:2.1_0: the absorptions associated with absorption, the mind associated with the mind,
ai-kv13.7:2.4_0: is included by two kinds of mind:
ai-kv13.7:2.5_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv13.7:3.3_0: Skillful thoughts are profitable and unprofitable, inferior and superior states, dark and on the side of dark and bright.
ai-kv13.7:3.4_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv13.7:4.1_0: Skillful thoughts are profitable and unprofitable, inferior and superior states, dark and on the side of dark and bright.
ai-kv13.7:4.4_0: “Mendicants, these four things are very far apart.
ai-kv13.7:4.7_0: This is the first thing that is easy to teach for someone who is easy to teach and the Dhamma. That’s why it is for one who is assured.”
ai-kv13.7:4.11_0: “He is skilled in what is unskillful and blameworthy, and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.”
ai-kv13.7:5.2_0: “Surely they are reborn in the company of the jhānas.”
ai-kv13.7:5.5_0: “Mendicants, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-kv13.7:5.11_0: for it is when someone has attained the gratification in it, the object of it is declared.
